CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures ( T d ) of P1-P7 ( 5% weight loss ) are 405 , 407 , 413 , 417 , 433 , 433 , and 444 °C , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
|--------------|
| P1           |
| P2           |
| P3           |
| P4           |
| P5           |
| P6           |
| P7           |

These entities (P1-P7) are clearly referred to as materials in the paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures ( T d ) of P1-P7 ( 5% weight loss ) are 405 , 407 , 413 , 417 , 433 , 433 , and 444 °C , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Decomposition temperatures (T d) |
| Of P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, P6, and P7 |
| For 5% weight loss |
| For P1: 405 °C |
| For P2: 407 °C |
| For P3: 413 °C |
| For P4: 417 °C |
| For P5: 433 °C |
| For P6: 433 °C |
| For P7: 444 °C |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Decomposition temperatures (T d) |
| For P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, P6, and P7 |
| For the specified weight loss percentage |
| For P1: 405 °C |
| For P2: 407 °C |
| For P3: 413 °C |
| For P4: 417 °C |
| For P5: 433 °C |
| For P6: 433 °C |
| For P7: 444 °C |

Note: The "of" in "of P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, P6, and P7" is removed as it does not clearly refer to a material property. The "specified weight loss percentage" is kept as it refers to the condition under which the decomposition temperatures were measured.

Note: In this case, all identified entities refer to material properties (decomposition temperatures), so all are valid. However, including the explicit reference to "material property" or "property value" in the table is a good practice to ensure clarity.
